meanings.definition: To swallow up or overwhelm completely.
meanings.sent1: The giant wave seemed to ingulf the tiny boat.
meanings.sent2: The darkness of the night ingulfed the entire forest.
meanings.sent3: The hungry puppy tried to ingulf its food in one bite.
meanings.sent4: The loud music ingulfed the room, drowning out all other sounds.
meanings.sent5: The flames quickly ingulfed the old wooden house.

meanings.sent1: The thick fog began to ingulf the city, hiding everything from view.
meanings.sent2: The warm embrace of the blanket ingulfed the child, making them feel safe.
meanings.sent3: The group of friends decided to ingulf the shy new student with kindness.
meanings.sent4: The ivy slowly ingulfed the old stone wall, covering it in green leaves.
meanings.sent5: The sandstorm started to ingulf the small desert town, causing panic among the residents.

meanings.sent1: The diver prepared to ingulf himself in the deep blue ocean.
meanings.sent2: The chef carefully watched the pasta as it started to ingulf in boiling water.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled as they tried to ingulf each other in a game of tag.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds began to ingulf the sky, signaling an approaching thunderstorm.
meanings.sent5: The quicksand threatened to ingulf the unsuspecting hiker, trapping them in its grip.
